reserves.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a company’s profits from previous periods of time that have not been paid to shareholders
reserves.translation[0].definitions[0].e: They have invested their reserves very conservatively.

reserves.translation[0].definitions[1].d: amounts kept aside by a company in its accounts to be used if needed. The amount a company has in reserves has to be taken away when calculating profit for a particular period of time
reserves.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The company had a loss of $15.2 million, or 74 cents a share, after setting up reserves to reflect property depreciation  (=falls in the value of property it owned).
reserves.translation[0].definitions[2].d: money held by a bank and used to pay out money to customers when they ask for it. The amount that must be kept in this way is decided by government
reserves.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The Bank of Japan slashed by 40% the reserves banks must keep at the central bank.
reserves.translation[0].definitions[3].d: an amount of something valuable such as oil, gas etc
reserves.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Petroleum reserves now amount to the equivalent of 142 days’ supply.
